title: NSW releases another two mega lots at Lachlan's Line
text:
NSW state developer Landcom has continued its land release spree, putting out tenders for the sale of two more mega lots of land at Lachlan's Line, one of the few remaining brownfield ares for housing development in Sydney's northern suburbs.

Frasers Property Australia and Chinese developer Greenland have already trailblazed two projects in the precinct, with Frasers developing a site north of the future North Ryde metro with 380 units and Greenland building the bigger "nbh" 900-unit project over a second, 1.2-hectare site.

Early render of more development at Lachlan's Line in Sydney's north by Bates Smart.

The two new sites on offer are the 5790sq m Stage-2 block and the 1.3 hectare Stage-3 block. Both have already been rezoned for high-density development.

Nearly 1000 apartments across building heights of between 33 to 99 metres can be accommodated across the sites.

While a price guide hasn't been set, Greenland purchased its 1.2 hectare site in 2015 for about $190 million.
description: Developers will like the two lots at Lachlan’s Line, one of the few remaining brownfield ares for housing development in Sydney's northern suburbs.
